thread.title: What Tom Brady's missing jersey is worth
thread.title_full: What Tom Brady's missing jersey is worth

author: USA TODAY Sports
title: What Tom Brady's missing jersey is worth
text:
What Tom Brady's missing jersey is worth Better find that jersey. Post to Facebook What Tom Brady's missing jersey is worth Better find that jersey.  //ftw.usatoday.com/2017/02/tom-brady-missing-jersey-worth/   Join the Nation's Conversation To   What Tom Brady's missing jersey is worth Nina Mandell , USA TODAY Sports 5:09 p.m. ET Feb. 6, 2017 
The location of Tom Brady's Super Bowl jersey , according to one sports memorabilia expert, is actually a million dollar question. 
Josh Evans, the founder and chairman of the auction website Lelands.com, said that if he was given the jersey to sell - by a legitimate seller - it could fetch into seven figures. 
"I would not have a hard decision to make in pricing that at a million. I think if we auctioned it off it would probably sell for a million. That's a lot for a modern jersey. The key is that you probably have to sell it very quickly because now is the time when people are the most excited and the most fanatic about these kinds of things. Five years from now something else will happen, something else will occur and it will probably go down in value." 
Without the disappearance of the jersey and everything surrounding the Super Bowl, the value of the jersey according to Evans, would probably around $250,000. 
"But now with all this hoopla, if you could find the right guy you could sell it for a million," he said. 
If it's stolen though? 
Worthless, at least in a auction place like Leland's, he said. 
"It's such a big story that you couldn't sell it legitimately â€¦" he said. "There is probably a black market for sports memorabilia. I'm sure it's not as technical as that, it's just a guy willing to own something like that knowing that it's stolen. But I don't know those people. So to me it's worth zero, but you know, legitimate it's amazing. Illegitimate? It's un-sellable." 
Though a million may seem like a hefty sum, it's nowhere near the highest that Lelands has fetched for a sports jersey. The auction house once sold a Babe Ruth jersey to $4.5 million to a private buyer. 
If Brady's jersey is stolen - and not innocently misplaced - he won't be the only one with some stolen memorabilia. Several piece of Kobe Bryant memorabilia was stolen recently from Lower Merion High School according to Philly.com.
